title: Fermat pseudoprimes
content: "In number theory, the _Fermat pseudoprimes_ make up the most important class of pseudoprimes that come from Fermat's little theorem ... [[which] states that if p is prime and a is coprime to p, then a^(p-1)-1 is divisible by p [[see ~ fermltl ]. For an integer a > 1, if a composite integer x divides a^(x-1)-1, then x is called a Fermat pseudoprime to base a. In other words, a composite integer is a Fermat pseudoprime to base a if it successfully passes the Fermat primality test for the base a. The false statement [[see ~ nfermltl2rev ] that all numbers that pass the Fermat primality test for base 2, are prime, is called the Chinese hypothesis.", see Wikipedia "Fermat pseudoprime", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fermat_pseudoprime , 29-May-2023.

blocks.name: cfppr
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the Fermat pseudoprimes.
blocks.origin: const class cfppr { FPPr }

blocks.name: diff.cfppr.s
diff.cfppr.c
diff.cfppr.w
df-fppr
blocks.content: Define the function that maps a positive integer to the set of _Fermat pseudoprimes_ to the base of this positive integer. Since Fermat pseudoprimes shall be composite (positive) integers, they must be nonprime integers greater than or equal to 4 (we cannot use ` x e. NN ` ` /\ x e/ Prime ` because ` x = 1 ` would fulfil this requirement, but should not be regarded as "composite" integer). (Contributed by AV, 29-May-2023.)

blocks.name: fpprmod
blocks.content: The set of Fermat pseudoprimes to the base ` N ` , expressed by a modulo operation instead of the divisibility relation. (Contributed by AV, 30-May-2023.)

  rabbidva(s0, cfv(cuz, nat4), wcel(c0, cn), wa(wnel(cv(s0), cprime), wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cmin, nat1))), wa(wnel(cv(s0), cprime), wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cmo, cv(s0)), nat1)))
  anbi2d(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, nat4))), wnel(cv(s0), cprime), wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cmin, nat1)), wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cmo, cv(s0)), nat1))
  bicomd(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, nat4))), wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cmin, nat1)), wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cmo, cv(s0)), nat1))
  syl2an2(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, nat4)), wb(wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cmo, cv(s0)), nat1), wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cmin, nat1))), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)), cz))
  eluz4eluz2(cv(s0))

  nnz(c0)

  eluz4nn(cv(s0))
  nnm1nn0(cv(s0))
  zexpcl(c0, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1))
  modm1div(cv(s0), co(c0, cexp, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)))

  elrab(hs0, c1, cfv(cuz, nat4), wa(wnel(cv(hs0), cprime), wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, co(cv(hs0), cmin, nat1)), cmo, cv(hs0)), nat1)), wa(wnel(c1, cprime), wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c1), nat1)))

  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  3anass(wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, nat4)), wnel(c1, cprime), wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, co(c1, cmin, nat1)), cmo, c1), nat1))

blocks.name: fpprbasnn
blocks.content: The base of a Fermat pseudoprime is a positive integer. (Contributed by AV, 30-May-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm fpprbasnn(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cfppr, c1)), wcel(c1, cn))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cfppr, c1)), wcel(c1, cn)), wcel(c1, cn))
  ax-1(wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c0, cfv(cfppr, c1)))
  syl(wn(wcel(c1, cn)), wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cfppr, c1)), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(cfv(cfppr, c1), emptycls))
  fvmptndm(hs0, c1, cn, cfppr, crab(hs1, cfv(cuz, nat4), wa(wnel(cv(hs1), cprime), wbr(cv(hs1), cdvds, co(co(cv(hs0), cexp, co(cv(hs1), cmin, nat1)), cmin, nat1)))))
  df-fppr(hs0, hs1)
  syl6bi(wceq(cfv(cfppr, c1), emptycls), wcel(c0, cfv(cfppr, c1)), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c0, emptycls))
  eleq2(cfv(cfppr, c1), emptycls, c0)
  pm2.21i(wcel(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, cn))
  noel(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fpprbasnn(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(FPPr ` c1)→ c1 ∈ ℕ)
} = {
  pm2.61i((c0 ∈(FPPr ` c1)→ c1 ∈ ℕ), c1 ∈ ℕ)
  ax-1(c1 ∈ ℕ, c0 ∈(FPPr ` c1))
  syl(¬ c1 ∈ ℕ, (c0 ∈(FPPr ` c1)→ c1 ∈ ℕ), (FPPr ` c1)= ∅)
  fvmptndm(hs0, c1, cn, cfppr, { hs1 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 4)|(hs1 ∉ Prime ∧ hs1[||]((hs0[^](hs1[-]1))[-]1))})
  df-fppr(hs0, hs1)
  syl6bi((FPPr ` c1)= ∅, c0 ∈(FPPr ` c1), c1 ∈ ℕ, c0 ∈ ∅)
  eleq2((FPPr ` c1), emptycls, c0)
  pm2.21i(c0 ∈ ∅, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  noel(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
}

blocks.name: nfermltl8rev

blocks.name: nfermltlrev
blocks.content: Fermat's little theorem reversed is not generally true: There are integers ` a ` and ` p ` so that " ` p ` is prime" does not follow from ` a ^ p == a ` (mod ` p ` ). (Contributed by AV, 3-Jun-2023.)
